questions.question: What is the primary function of HTML?
options: A) To create dynamic web pages.
B) To add interactivity to a website.
C) To define the structure and content of a webpage.
D) To handle user input on a website.
questions.correct_answer: C) To define the structure and content of a webpage.

questions.question: What is the purpose of CSS?
options: A) To add interactivity to a website.
B) To handle user input on a website.
C) To separate presentation from structure and content.
D) To define the layout of a webpage.
questions.correct_answer: C) To separate presentation from structure and content.

questions.question: What is JavaScript used for?
options: A) To create static web pages.
B) To add interactivity to a website.
C) To handle user input on a website.
D) To define the structure and content of a webpage.
questions.correct_answer: B) To add interactivity to a website.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Node.js?
options: A) To create dynamic web pages.
B) To handle user input on a website.
C) To run JavaScript outside of a browser.
D) To add interactivity to a website.
questions.correct_answer: C) To run JavaScript outside of a browser.

questions.question: What is the primary function of a framework?
options: A) To provide a set of pre-built components.
B) To handle user input on a website.
C) To define the structure and content of a webpage.
D) To add interactivity to a website.
questions.correct_answer: A) To provide a set of pre-built components.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of education?
options: A) To prepare students for a career in sports.
B) To provide basic knowledge and skills for everyday life.
C) To encourage critical thinking and problem-solving.
D) To develop physical strength and endurance.
questions.correct_answer: B) To provide basic knowledge and skills for everyday life.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a non-formal education?
options: A) Formal schooling in a traditional classroom.
B) Online courses offered by a university.
questions.correct_answer: C) Literacy programs for adults.

questions.question: What is the term for the process of learning through hands-on experience?
questions.correct_answer: C) Experiential learning.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key benefit of early childhood education?
options: A) Improved academic performance in later years.
B) Enhanced social skills and emotional intelligence.
D) Better physical health and well-being.
questions.correct_answer: B) Enhanced social skills and emotional intelligence.

questions.question: What is the term for a system of education that focuses on teaching students to think critically and solve problems?
questions.correct_answer: C) Inquiry-based learning.

questions.question: What is the primary responsibility of a Software Development Engineer?
options: A) Designing and implementing software solutions.
B) Managing project timelines and budgets.
C) Conducting code reviews and ensuring code quality.
D) Providing technical support to customers.
questions.correct_answer: A) Designing and implementing software solutions.

questions.question: What programming language is most commonly used in the industry?
questions.correct_answer: B) Java

questions.question: What is the term for a software development methodology that emphasizes flexibility and rapid delivery?
questions.correct_answer: B) Agile

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using a cloud-based infrastructure?
options: A) Reduced costs and increased scalability.
questions.correct_answer: A) Reduced costs and increased scalability.

questions.question: What is the term for a software development technique that involves breaking down complex problems into smaller, manageable pieces?
questions.correct_answer: A) Decomposition

questions.question: What is the primary goal of a Machine Learning Engineer?
options: A) To design and implement machine learning models that are highly interpretable
B) To develop algorithms that can learn from data without human intervention
C) To create systems that can reason like humans
D) To build predictive models that can make accurate decisions
questions.correct_answer: B) To develop algorithms that can learn from data without human intervention

questions.question: What is the primary tool used by a Machine Learning Engineer to implement machine learning models?
questions.correct_answer: C) Scikit-Learn

questions.question: What is the primary metric used to evaluate the performance of a machine learning model?
questions.correct_answer: A) Accuracy

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using a machine learning model in a real-world application?
questions.correct_answer: C) To improve predictive accuracy

questions.question: What is the primary challenge faced by a Machine Learning Engineer when working with large datasets?
questions.correct_answer: D) To ensure data quality
